newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia palm olein weaker in quiet trade.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia palm olein weaker in quiet trade.

text.p: Indonesian palm olein prices were weaker in late trading on Friday as buyers stayed sidelined amid reports of election-related violence in Jakarta, traders said.
They said palm olein was quoted at 1,420 rupiah/kg in Jakarta, down from 1,425-30 rupiah at the opening.
"There was hardly any movement in the market today because of reports of violence in the city," one trader said. "Many players closed early, while others did not open at all."
Another trader said his business had ground to a halt as his buyers showed no interest in purchasing oil because of the tense situation in the capital.
The traders said demand was expected to remain weak until after the elections, adding that players were likely to stay cautious next week although the campaign ends on Friday.
"Prices are likely to ease further next week as demand will continue to be poor," one trader said.
"They did not want to take the risk of ordering oil today because of the situation in the capital," he added.
Violence flared between supporters of the ruling Golkar party and the Moslem-oriented United Development Party (PPP) on Friday, the final day of the campaign for the May 29 election.
Witnesses said police fired tear gas and warning shots into the air to break up a clash between the two groups in the Ciputat area in south Jakarta.
"There was hardly any activity in the market today because of reports of violence and, more so, because of the swirling rumours of riots and disturbances," he said.
